attributes.description:
Customers should anticipate adding 15 minutes to their normal trip during this time.

We are improving Green Line resiliency by installing flood mitigation and prevention measures, including large steel doors at the entrance to the subway tunnel. Learn more at https://www.mbta.com/fenwayportal

If you have questions and concerns regarding the Fenway Portal Project, please email FenwayPortalProject@mbta.com.

All shuttle bus stops are accessible to persons with disabilities. Please allow additional time for your commute.

Please note, there will be NO shuttle bus service to Beaconsfield Station. Customers should use Reservoir (9 minute walk) or Dean Road on the C Branch (2 minute walk).

Affected stops:
Kenmore
Fenway
Longwood
Brookline Village
Brookline Hills
Beaconsfield
Reservoir
attributes.header: Bus shuttles will replace Green Line D service between Kenmore and Reservoir during weekends, January 5 - March 24, excluding February 3 and March 16-17.
attributes.short_header: Bus shuttles will replace Green Line D service between Kenmore and Reservoir during weekends, Jan 5 - Mar 24, excluding Feb 3 and Mar 16-17

attributes.description:
We are working with our vendor to solve GPS tracking on D branch trains in the Newton area. We have deactivated countdown clocks at some D branch stations so that we are not providing incorrect predictions.

Thank you for your patience as we work to resolve this issue.
attributes.header: Green Line D branch notice: We are experiencing an issue with GPS tracking on D branch trains in the Newton area.
attributes.short_header: Green Line D branch notice: We are experiencing an issue with GPS tracking on D branch trains in the Newton area.

attributes.description:
If exiting at Central Square, continue to Kendall Station and utilize free shuttle bus service to Central Square.  The shuttle pick-up location is on Main St. near the station entrance for the Alewife platform.  Please see station personnel or utilize a station call box to request the shuttle.

If boarding at Central Square, utilize free shuttle bus for service to Kendall Station.  The shuttle pick-up location is on Massachusetts Ave. near Elevator 861.  Please see station personnel or utilize the station call box at street-level to request the shuttle.  As an alternative, cross the street and take Elevator 860 to the Alewife-bound platform. Take the Red Line to Harvard Square and switch to an Ashmont-/Braintree-bound train.
attributes.header: Central Elevator 861 (Ashmont/Braintree Platform to Street) is out of service through Spring 2019 to allow for this unit to be replaced.
attributes.short_header: Central Elevator 861 (Ashmont/Braintree Platform to Street) is out of service through Spring 2019 to allow for this unit to be replaced.

attributes.description:
These evening shuttles are scheduled to occur every Sunday through Thursday nights from December 9 to January 17. This is to allow for work at both Wollaston and Quincy Center stations. 

Regular train service will run December 23-27 and December 30 - January 3 for the holidays.

All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities. Regularly scheduled service will resume at the start of service the following day.

attributes.description:
All MBTA service, including the Commuter Rail, will be free after 8 pm on New Year's Eve. 

Bikes, including folding bikes, are not allowed on all inbound trains between 10 am and 6 pm and on all outbound trains from 4 pm until the end of service.

For additional information visit mbta.com/holidays.
attributes.header: On New Year's Eve, the Commuter Rail will run on a regular weekday schedule with some changes to last train departure times due to the fireworks.
attributes.short_header: On New Year's Eve, the Commuter Rail will run on a regular weekday schedule with some changes to last train departure times.

Middleborough/Lakeville Line
Kingston/Plymouth Line

attributes.description:
During MassDOT's construction on the Tobin Bridge and North Washington Street, the Commuter Rail will accept CharlieCards between Chelsea and North Station (on the Newburyport/Rockport Line) through summer 2019. The trip into North Station is approximately 12 minutes, and trains leave roughly every 30 minutes during peak hours. Schedule for Newburyport/Rockport is available here: https://www.mbta.com/schedules/CR-Newburyport/timetable 

Customers should show their CharlieCard to the conductor or fare inspector when asked. CharlieCards are available at Haymarket and other major stations between 7 AM and 7 PM (2:30 PM on Sundays at Haymarket). Please see a station agent for assistance or visit https://www.mbta.com/fares/charliecard for details.
attributes.header: Due to construction on the Tobin Bridge & N. Washington St, we anticipate delays to local bus Routes 111, 112, 114, 116, & 117. The Commuter Rail will accept CharlieCards between Chelsea & North Station to provide alternate service options for customers.
attributes.short_header: Due to construction on the Tobin Bridge & N Washington St, we expect delays to local Rts. 111, 112, 114, 116, & 117. The Commuter Rail will

attributes.description:
Customers looking to exit the Red Line at Andrew should exit at Broadway and utilize a station call box or see station personnel to request shuttle bus service to Andrew. Shuttle bus pick-up is located on the Dorchester Avenue side of Broadway Station. Customers looking to board at Andrew should utilize shuttle bus service to Broadway to make Red Line connections. 

The elevators are being taken out of service to facilitate a full replacement of the elevator lifts, hydraulics, and electrical systems.

attributes.description:
Customers are advised that the pedestrian route for customers transferring from the Green and Orange Line exits at Causeway and Beverly St into North Station Commuter Rail will be moved slightly to accommodate ongoing construction work. 

After crossing Causeway St, pedestrians will use a protected walkway along the east side of Legends Way, directly abutting Portal Park. The walkway will include a barrier and kick-plate for blind and low vision passengers.

As an alternative, customers may consider utilizing the west exit from North Station Commuter Rail due to congestion.
attributes.header: Access to the east entrance of North Station is available through a covered walkway. Legends Way is closed to pedestrian access.
